app.title: Emergency Supply Tracker
app.tagline: Track your emergency supplies and stay prepared

metadata.title: Emergency Supply Tracker - Preparedness Planning
metadata.description: Track your emergency supplies and ensure preparedness for your household. Plan water, food, medical supplies, and more with this free tool.
metadata.keywords: emergency preparedness, emergency kit, emergency supplies, disaster planning, survival kit tracker, emergency checklist, household preparedness
metadata.ogDescription: Track emergency supplies for your household. Ensure preparedness with our free planning tool. No signup required, works offline.
metadata.twitterDescription: Free tool to track emergency supplies for your household. Plan water, food, medical supplies, and more.

help.title: Help & FAQ
help.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about using the Emergency Supply Tracker
help.contactText: Report bugs, suggest features, leave feedback, or contribute‚Äîvisit our GitHub repository to participate and help improve the app.

gettingStarted.question: How do I get started?
gettingStarted.answer:
When you open the app for the first time, you'll be guided through an onboarding process. The process will help you:

1. Select your language (English/Finnish)
2. Choose a household preset or configure it manually
3. Set up your household information (adults, children, supply duration)
4. Add recommended items to your inventory or start with an empty inventory

After onboarding, you can start using the app. You can modify household settings later from the Settings tab.

householdSize.question: Why does household size matter?
householdSize.answer: Recommended quantities are calculated based on your household size and supply duration. For example, a family of 4 planning for 72 hours will need more supplies than a single person.

recommendedItems.question: What are recommended items?
recommendedItems.answer: Recommended items are pre-configured templates based on emergency preparedness guidelines. They include suggested quantities, units, and categories to help you build a complete emergency supply kit.

expirationDates.question: How do expiration dates work?
expirationDates.answer: Items can have expiration dates or be marked as 'Never Expires'. The app will alert you when items are expiring soon (within 30 days) or have already expired. Some items like batteries and medications should be rotated regularly.

categories.question: What are the different categories?
categories.answer: The app organizes supplies into 9 categories: Water & Beverages, Food, Cooking & Heat, Light & Power, Communication & Info, Medical & Health, Hygiene & Sanitation, Tools & Supplies, and Cash & Documents. This helps you ensure comprehensive coverage across all essential supply types.

statusColors.question: What do the status colors mean?
statusColors.answer:
Green (OK) = You have adequate supplies
Yellow (Warning) = Supplies are low or expiring soon
Red (Critical) = Supplies are out of stock or expired

The dashboard shows color-coded status for each category.

exportImport.question: How do I backup my data?
exportImport.answer: Go to Settings ‚Üí Data Management and click 'Export Data'. This downloads a JSON file with all your data. You can import this file later to restore your data or transfer it to another device.

dataStorage.question: Where is my data stored?
dataStorage.answer: All data is stored locally in your browser's localStorage. Nothing is sent to external servers, ensuring your privacy. However, clearing browser data will delete your inventory, so use the export feature for backups.

shoppingList.question: How do I create a shopping list?
shoppingList.answer: Go to Settings ‚Üí Data Management and click 'Export Shopping List'. This generates a text file listing all items that need restocking, grouped by category with current vs. recommended quantities.

preparednessScore.question: How is the preparedness score calculated?
preparednessScore.answer: The score is based on the percentage of recommended items you have in adequate quantities. It considers: stocked items vs. recommended items, current quantities vs. recommended quantities, and expiration status. A score of 80% or higher indicates good preparedness.

howIsItFree.question: How can this be free?
howIsItFree.answer:
‚Ä¢ This application was developed for personal use and is shared openly for others to benefit from
‚Ä¢ AI has significantly accelerated development, so development has been quite fast. Status 01/2026: About 50 hours of work time invested
‚Ä¢ Running costs are minimal, as the app runs entirely in the browser
‚Ä¢ Hosted on GitHub Pages (free)
‚Ä¢ CI/CD and project management on GitHub (free)
‚Ä¢ Development and other tools (free)
‚Ä¢ The only cost is the domain, approximately $10 per year

tips.tip1: Set realistic supply duration (72 hours minimum, 2 weeks recommended)
tips.tip2: Check expiration dates regularly and rotate supplies before they expire
tips.tip3: Store emergency supplies in accessible, labeled containers
tips.tip4: Export your data regularly as a backup
tips.tip5: Review and update your inventory at least once per season
